member.summary: Value type for a measurement.

member.summary: Time.

member.name: T:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordHeader
member.summary: The header of a PQDIF . The header is part of the physical structure of a PQDIF file, and contains information on how to parse the as well as how to find the next record.

member.name: M:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordHeader.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the record header.
member.returns: A string representation of the record header.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordHeader.RecordSignature
member.summary: Gets or sets the record's globally unique identifier.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordHeader.TypeOfRecord
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the record which determines the logical structure of the record.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordHeader.RecordTypeTag
member.summary: Gets or sets the tag which identifies the type of the record.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordHeader.HeaderSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the header, in bytes.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordHeader.BodySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the body, in bytes.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordHeader.NextRecordPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the next record in the PQDIF file. This value is a byte offset relative to the beginning of the file.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordHeader.Checksum
member.summary: Optional checksum (such as a 32-bit CRC) of the record body to verify decompression.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordHeader.Reserved
member.summary: Reserved to fill structure to 64 bytes. Should be filled with 0.

member.name: T:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord
member.summary: Represents an observation record in a PQDIF file.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: The physical structure of the observation record.
The data source record that defines the channels in this observation record.
The monitor settings to be applied to this observation record.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord.ObservationNameTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies the name of the observation record.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord.TimeCreateTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies the time that the observation record was created.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord.TimeStartTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies the start time of the data in the observation record.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord.TriggerMethodTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies the type of trigger that caused the observation.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord.ChannelInstancesTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies the channel instances collection.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord.OneChannelInstanceTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies a single channel instance in the collection.

member.name: M:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord.CreateObservationRecord(openPQDIF.Physical.Record,openPQDIF.Logical.DataSourceRecord,openPQDIF.Logical.MonitorSettingsRecord)
member.summary: Creates a new observation record from the given physical record if the physical record is of type observation. Returns null if it is not.
member.param: The physical record used to create the observation record.
The data source record that defines the channels in this observation record.
The monitor settings to be applied to this observation record.
member.returns: The new observation record, or null if the physical record does not define a observation record.

member.summary: Gets the data source record that defines the channels in this observation record.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord.Settings
member.summary: Gets the monitor settings record that defines the settings to be applied to this observation record.

member.summary: Gets the name of the observation record.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord.StartTime
member.summary: Gets the starting time of the data in the observation record.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Logical.ObservationRecord.ChannelInstances
member.summary: Gets the channel instances in this observation record.

member.summary: Time-domain measurements including magnitudes and (optionally) phase angle.

member.summary: Frequency-domain measurements including magnitude and (optionally) phase angle.

member.summary: X-values and y-values.

member.summary: Magnitude and duration.

member.summary: X-values, y-values, and z-values.

member.summary: Time, magnitude, and duration.

member.name: T:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType
member.summary: Enumeration that defines the types of values stored in s and s.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Boolean1
member.summary: 1-byte boolean

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Boolean2
member.summary: 2-byte boolean

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Boolean4
member.summary: 4-byte boolean

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Char1
member.summary: 1-byte character (ASCII)

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Char2
member.summary: 2-byte character (UTF-16)

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Integer1
member.summary: 8-bit signed integer

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Integer2
member.summary: 16-bit signed integer

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Integer4
member.summary: 32-bit signed integer

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.UnsignedInteger1
member.summary: 8-bit unsigned integer

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.UnsignedInteger2
member.summary: 16-bit unsigned integer

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.UnsignedInteger4
member.summary: 32-bit unsigned integer

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Real4
member.summary: 32-bit floating point number

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Real8
member.summary: 64-bit floating point number

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Complex8
member.summary: 8-byte complex number
member.remarks: The first four bytes represent the real part of the complex number, and the last four bytes represent the imaginary part. Both values are 64-bit floating point numbers.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Complex16
member.summary: 16-byte complex number
member.remarks: The first eight bytes represent the real part of the complex number, and the last eight bytes represent the imaginary part. Both values are 64-bit floating point numbers.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Timestamp
member.summary: 12-byte timestamp
member.remarks: The first four bytes represent the days since January 1, 1900 UTC. The last eight bytes represent the number of seconds since midnight. The number of days is an unsigned 32-bit integer, and the number of seconds is a 64-bit floating point number.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalType.Guid
member.summary: 128-bit globally unique identifier

member.summary: Defines extension methods for .

member.summary: Gets the size of the physical type, in bytes.
member.param: The physical type.
member.returns: The size of the physical type, in bytes.

member.name: T:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordBody
member.summary: The body of a PQDIF . The body is part of the physical structure of a PQDIF file. It laid out as a hierarchy of s, starting with a that contains other elements.

member.name: M:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordBody.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the record body.
member.returns: A string representation of the record body.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordBody.Collection
member.summary: Gets or sets the at the top of the hierarchy. This can be used to traverse the hierarchy.

member.name: T:openPQDIF.Physical.CompressionStyle
member.summary: Enumeration which defines the types of compression used in PQDIF files.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.CompressionStyle.None
member.summary: No compression.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.CompressionStyle.TotalFile
member.summary: Compress the entire file after the container record. This compression style is deprecated and is currently not supported by this PQDIF library.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.CompressionStyle.RecordLevel
member.summary: Compress the body of each record.

member.name: T:openPQDIF.Physical.CompressionAlgorithm
member.summary: Enuemration which defines the algorithms used to compress PQDIF files.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.CompressionAlgorithm.None
member.summary: No compression.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.CompressionAlgorithm.Zlib
member.summary: Zlib compression. http://www.zlib.net/

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.CompressionAlgorithm.PKZIP
member.summary: PKZIP compression. This compression algorithm is deprecated and is currently not supported by this PQDIF library.

member.name: T:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalParser
member.summary: Represents a parser which parses the physical structure of a PQDIF file.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: Name of the PQDIF file to be parsed.

member.name: M:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalParser.Open
member.summary: Opens the PQDIF file.

member.name: M:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalParser.HasNextRecord
member.summary: Returns true if this parser has not reached the end of the PQDIF file.
member.returns: false if the end of the file has been reached; true otherwise

member.name: M:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalParser.NextRecord
member.summary: Reads the next record from the PQDIF file.
member.returns: The next record to be parsed from the PQDIF file.

member.name: M:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalParser.Reset
member.summary: Sets the parser back to the beginning of the file.

member.name: M:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalParser.Close
member.summary: Closes the PQDIF file.

member.name: M:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalParser.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources held by this parser.

member.summary: Gets or sets the file name of the PQDIF file to be parsed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the compression style used by the PQDIF file.

member.name: P:openPQDIF.Physical.PhysicalParser.CompressionAlgorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression algorithm used by the PQDIF file.

member.name: T:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordType
member.summary: Enumeration that defines type of record as per header definition.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordType.Container
member.summary: Represents a record level tag which identifies the container record. Always the first one in the file, and only one per file.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordType.DataSource
member.summary: Represents a record level tag which identifies the data source record. Instrument level information.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordType.MonitorSettings
member.summary: Represents an optional record level tag which identifies configuration parameters. Used to capture configuration changes on the data source.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordType.Observation
member.summary: Represents a record-level tag which identifies an observation. Used to capture an event, measurements etc.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Physical.RecordType.Unknown
member.summary: Represents a record-level tag which is unknown to this library.

member.summary: A-to-neutral.

member.summary: C-to-A.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.Phase.Residual
member.summary: Residual - the vector or point-on-wave sum of Phases A, B, and C. Should be zero in a perfectly balanced system.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.Phase.Net
member.summary: Net - the vector or point-on-wave sum of Phases A, B, C and the Neutral phase. Should be zero in a 4-wire system with no earth return path.

member.name: T:openPQDIF.Logical.MonitorSettingsRecord
member.summary: Represents a monitor settings record in a PQDIF file.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: The physical structure of the monitor settings record.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.MonitorSettingsRecord.EffectiveTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies the time that these settings become effective.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.MonitorSettingsRecord.TimeInstalledTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies the install time.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.MonitorSettingsRecord.UseCalibrationTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies the flag which determines whether to apply calibration to the series.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.MonitorSettingsRecord.UseTransducerTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies the flag which determines whether to apply transducer adjustments to the series.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.MonitorSettingsRecord.ChannelSettingsArrayTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies the collection of channel settings.

member.name: F:openPQDIF.Logical.MonitorSettingsRecord.OneChannelSettingTag
member.summary: Tag that identifies one channel setting in the collection.

member.name: M:openPQDIF.Logical.MonitorSettingsRecord.CreateMonitorSettingsRecord(openPQDIF.Physical.Record)
member.summary: Creates a new monitor settings record from the given physical record if the physical record is of type monitor settings. Returns null if it is not.
member.param: The physical record used to create the monitor settings record.
member.returns: The new monitor settings record, or null if the physical record does not define a monitor settings record.
